title.text: HOW TO DRIVE A DATABASE FRONT DID USING GENERAL SEMANTIC INFORMATION

entities.text: TO DRIVE A DATABASE FRONT DID USING GENERAL SEMANTIC INFORMATION

abstractContent.text: This paper describes a front end for natural language access to databases making extensive use of general, l~.
domain-independent, semantic information for question interpretation.

In the interests of portability, initial syntactic and semantic processing of a question is carried out without any reference to the database domain, and domain-dependent operations are confined to subsequent, comparatively straightforward.
The different modules of the front end are described, and the system's performance is illustrated by examples.
